note.p: Career: Lieutenant of the Marchaux, France (during the Revolution); emigrated and joined the "Army of Conde" against the Revolution; fled to England and took charge of the collections of Lord Granville and Sir Abraham Hume (FRS 1775); formed a collection which became the property of Sir John St Aubyn (FRS 1797); returned to France and became Director General of Louis XVIII's mineralogical cabinet (at the Restoration)
Notes: Is Bournon his surname, or was it used as such? Further work required.
